intro: Mammillaria crassimammillis, commonly known as the thick-mammilated hedgehog cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a dense covering of white, waxy spines. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and has a pale green to bluish-green stem. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in the axils of the spines. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
